meanings.definition: A person who engages in lively or mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The little boy at the party was a real pearter, running around and playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was never boring with that pearter around, always making jokes and causing laughter.
meanings.sent3: The pearter in the office decided to hide all the staplers as a prank, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her younger brother was a true pearter, always finding ways to stir up excitement wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous pearter left a trail of laughter and fun wherever he went.

meanings.definition: To behave in a lively or mischievous manner.
meanings.sent1: The children love to pearter around the playground, laughing and playing games.
meanings.sent2: During the party, the guests began to pearter around, dancing and enjoying themselves.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to pearter with a ball of yarn, rolling it around the room playfully.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the crowd started to pearter on the dance floor, moving energetically.
meanings.sent5: The friends would often pearter about, creating joyful memories together.
